page.title: 03DRAYTON MANOR PARK 2
page.content: Conflicting views: "An old stately home near Fazeley, now given over to amusement arcades, a fun fair and a very smelly zoo. It costs one pound for adults, 60p for children, and 30p for cars. None of which is at all worth it!" "However, another view is that for relatively little expense a family can spend a most enjoyable day. Recently a 6th form pupil from our school accompanied her aunt and small cousin for a day's outing. Each paid a nominal fee and were then allowed on most rides free for the day. The owners of the park have been most careful to retain the atmosphere." Several sixth formers who work at the park estimate "On an average Sunday approx 16 000 pounds is taken for rides alone." (wages,17yr old:95p/hr)
